newsitem.title: USA: Eight injured as USAir plane evacuated in Boston.
newsitem.headline: Eight injured as USAir plane evacuated in Boston.

text.p: Emergency crews evacuated 81 passengers from a USAirways DC-9 on Tuesday at Boston's Logan Airport after an engine caught fire.

USAirways Flight 1505, which was scheduled to depart for Pittsburgh, had pulled away from the gate when the pilot "was informed there was a fire in one of the engines. The fire was extinguished," Federal Aviation Administration spokeswoman Arlene Salac said.
"The passengers were evacuated. They used the chutes. There may have been minor injuries," she added.
Boston Emergency Medical Services reported they were treating six people for minor injuries and evaluating two others for cardiac problems.
The FAA will be investigating the incident, Salac said.
USAirways spokesman Richard Weintraub said there were 81 passengers and a crew of five was aboard when fire was reported in the engine made by Pratt & Whitney, a unit of United Technologies Corp..
Pratt & Whitney spokesman Mark Sullivan said the company had no information on the Boston incident, but if the plane involved was a DC-9, it must have used a Pratt engine.
